oracle.wsc.android.call

Class DataChannelOption

  • java.lang.Object
    • oracle.wsc.android.call.DataChannelOption

  • public class DataChannelOption
extends Object
    Provides options for configuring the data channel.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataChannelOption()
      Default option parameter for the data channel of a call.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getId()
      Gets the ID for the channel.
      int getMaxRetransmits()
      Gets the maximum number of times to try and retransmit a failed message.
      int getMaxRetransmitTimeMs()
      Gets the maximum time to try and retransmit a failed message.
      String getProtocol()
      Gets the protocol to be used for the data channel.
      boolean isNegotiated()
      Gets the negotiated value for the data channel.
      boolean isOrdered()
      Returns true if the data channel can guarantee order or not.
      void setId(int id)
      Allows you to provide your own ID for the channel.
      void setMaxRetransmits(int maxRetransmits)
      Sets the maximum number of times to try and retransmit a failed message.
      void setMaxRetransmitTimeMs(int maxRetransmitTimeMs)
      Sets the maximum retransmit time to try and retransmit a failed message.
      void setNegotiated(boolean negotiated)
      Sets the negotiated value.
      void setOrdered(boolean ordered)
      Set to true if the data channel should guarantee order or not.
      void setProtocol(String protocol)
      Sets the protocol to be used for the data channel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataChannelOption

        public DataChannelOption()
        Default option parameter for the data channel of a call.

    • Method Detail

      • isOrdered

        public boolean isOrdered()
        Returns true if the data channel can guarantee order or not.
        Returns:
        true if ordered.

      • setOrdered

        public void setOrdered(boolean ordered)
        Set to true if the data channel should guarantee order or not.
        Parameters:
        ordered - flag to guarantee order

      • getMaxRetransmitTimeMs

        public int getMaxRetransmitTimeMs()
        Gets the maximum time to try and retransmit a failed message.
        Returns:
        maximum retransmit time in milli-seconds.

      • setMaxRetransmitTimeMs

        public void setMaxRetransmitTimeMs(int maxRetransmitTimeMs)
        Sets the maximum retransmit time to try and retransmit a failed message. You can only specify maxRetransmits or maxRetransmitTime, not both.
        Parameters:
        maxRetransmitTimeMs - maximum retransmit time in milli-seconds.

      • getMaxRetransmits

        public int getMaxRetransmits()
        Gets the maximum number of times to try and retransmit a failed message.
        Returns:
        maximum retransmits.

      • setMaxRetransmits

        public void setMaxRetransmits(int maxRetransmits)
        Sets the maximum number of times to try and retransmit a failed message. You can only specify maxRetransmits or maxRetransmitTime, not both.
        Parameters:
        maxRetransmits - maximum retransmits.

      • getProtocol

        public String getProtocol()
        Gets the protocol to be used for the data channel.
        Returns:
        protocol

      • setProtocol

        public void setProtocol(String protocol)
        Sets the protocol to be used for the data channel. If the specified protocol is unsupported, data-channel will fail.
        Parameters:
        protocol - protocol value

      • isNegotiated

        public boolean isNegotiated()
        Gets the negotiated value for the data channel.
        Returns:
        true if negotiated.

      • setNegotiated

        public void setNegotiated(boolean negotiated)
        Sets the negotiated value. If set to true, it removes the automatic setting up of a data channel on the other peer. If unsupported, data-channel will fail.
        Parameters:
        negotiated - negotiated value

      • getId

        public int getId()
        Gets the ID for the channel.
        Returns:
        ID

      • setId

        public void setId(int id)
        Allows you to provide your own ID for the channel.
        Parameters:
        id - ID for data channel
